meanings.definition: To establish or settle in a specified condition or state.
meanings.sent1: She estated her room with colorful posters and cozy blankets.
meanings.sent2: The family estated themselves in the new house after unpacking all their belongings.
meanings.sent3: The cat estated itself on the sunny windowsill, claiming it as its own.
meanings.sent4: The artist estated her canvas with bold strokes of paint, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The garden was estated with blooming flowers, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.sent1: He estated his children with a vast inheritance to secure their future.
meanings.sent2: The generous philanthropist estated a portion of his wealth to charity.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly estated his hat with endless rabbits, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The ancient king estated his loyal knight with a grand castle as a reward for his bravery.
meanings.sent5: The fairy godmother estated the pumpkin with magical powers, transforming it into a carriage.

meanings.definition: To be in possession of an estate.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy family estated a vast property in the countryside.
meanings.sent2: After the legal process, she officially estated the ancestral home.
meanings.sent3: The ghost claimed to have estated the haunted mansion for centuries.
meanings.sent4: The nobleman proudly estated the grand estate passed down through generations.
meanings.sent5: The explorer stumbled upon an estated island hidden from the world for years.
